title: Facebook profit rises despite wave of political controversies
text:
Facebook’s profits have soared as the political controversies engulfing the social network appeared to do little to put off users or advertisers.

The social network reported net income of $6.1bn in the three months ending September 30, compared to $5.1bn the previous year.

Despite fears that user growth for its main service had plateaued in core markets like the US, revenue grew 29pc year-on-year, above Wall Street's expectations and suggesting there is plenty of mileage in emerging markets and through its subsidiaries, Instagram and WhatsApp.

Investments in compliance, a growing workforce and improving machine learning technology ate into its profit. But the leap in revenues, to $17.7bn, offset the spending.

Around 2.2bn people now use either Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp or Messenger every day and 2.8bn per month, it said. Daily users of Facebook itself increased 9pc year-on-year.
